content: LeBron James made an awful start to Game 3 of playoffs against Warriors Skip Bayless was among the critics as James failed to shoot in first quarter  DailyMail.com provides all the latest international sports news LeBron James wrote an unfortunate chapter into his career stats playing for the Lakers against Golden State on Saturday night.

The 38-year-old failed to take a shot in the first quarter of a playoff game for the first time in his career as his team fought to get back to winning ways in the series against the Warriors. He finally scored his first points of the night with 6:32 remaining in the second quarter as went on to get 21 points as the Lakers beat the Warriors 127-97.His first field goal came with 5:37 left on the clock in the second quarter and was met with generous cheers from the Lakers fans at the Crypto.com Arena.Skip Bayless was among the big-name voices who were stunned by James and his poor start to the game.

Taking to Twitter, Bayless wrote: 'COME ON, LEBRON, SNAP OUT OF IT. NO SHOTS AND NO FREE THROWS IN THE 1ST QUARTER AS WARRIORS LEAD BY 7??? 'INITIATE! ATTACK! IMPOSE YOUR WILL! YOU'RE THE ALL-TIME LEADING SCORER! ACT LIKE IT!'Ironically, James was pictured practicing his shooting five hours before the start of Saturday night's game.But James didn't hold his team back too badly in the first half - the Lakers had an 11-point lead at halftime. And he also made a positive piece of history. He overtook Kareem Abdul-Jabbar to move fifth on the all-time leaders list for total rebounds in the NBA playoffs.
The Lakers lead the series 2-1 after Saturday's victory. Game 4 is Monday night.
